long_desc.thetext: AbstractFocusViewAction causes unnecessary refreshes since it adds and removes single filters. Each addition and removal causes a refresh of the viewer. Changing the filters in a mass way like this should be done by using the setFilters(ViewerFilter[] filters) on StructuredViewer.

Wow, great find. The implementation has been updated as per your suggestion. This should provide a significant performance improvement for task activation.
In addition, when doing this note that I found a bug in lazy start not being called for AbstractContextUiPlugin if a context was null and fixed that too.

Created attachment 86723 patch with experimentation
Shawn: here's the experimentation from our pairing in order to reduce the frequency of expandAll being called. Take a look, since it appears to have a weird sideffect on the Task List which causes tasks not to show.

Created attachment 86733 experimentation patch with a change
This worked great for me. I did make a change to ensure that the filters that were changed during the period from the addition of the interest filter until when it was disabled are maintained. This means that if you activate a task, focus a view, add a filter, unfocus the view, the filter will not be removed.
Tagged the summary with [performance] so we remember to write a performance test case for this.

Steffen: Yes, thanks. We also need better test coverage on filter removal/addition, although we have some now.
Shawn: patch applied, with some changes made in order to preserve API.
